prompt.stem: A cyclist travelling along a straight track accelerates uniformly. The speed of the cyclist increases from 4.0 m s−1 to 7.5 m s−1 in 2.9 s. What is the distance travelled by the cyclist during this time?

level1: Use a constant-acceleration relationship from the data sheet.
level2: Find the acceleration, then use a distance equation involving time.

prompt.stem: A ball is projected horizontally from the top of a cliff. Which statement correctly describes the horizontal and vertical components of velocity (air resistance negligible)?
options: Horizontal velocity increases; vertical velocity is constant.
Horizontal velocity is constant; vertical velocity increases.
Horizontal velocity decreases; vertical velocity is constant.
Horizontal velocity increases; vertical velocity decreases.
Horizontal velocity is constant; vertical velocity is constant.

level1: Consider horizontal and vertical motion separately.
level2: There is no horizontal acceleration, but vertical acceleration due to gravity.

level3.content: aᵧ = g ⇒ vᵧ increases in magnitude
